Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Mastoparan-J (natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (53.33%) toLasioglossin LL-IIII=V=L=K=14%; Mol formula: C77H127N20O19; Mol Wt: 1635.965; Mol Ex Coeff: 5550; GRAVY:  0.35.Activity:  active against S. aureus (50% killing ED50 5 uM) and K+ effleux is demonstrated.Toxicity: 50% hemolysis (HC50) 100-200 uM.  human RBC: HC50 69.5 uM; rat RBC: HC50 60.1 uM (Ye et al., 2023).
Literature Information.Author: Nakao S, Komagoe K, Inoue T, Katsu T.2011
Literature Information.Title: Comparative study of the membrane-permeabilizing activities of mastoparans and related histamine-releasing agents in bacteria, erythrocytes, and mast cells.
